required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase Ib Study of HX008 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib Study of Tolerance and Safety of a Recombinant Anti-PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody HX008 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: HX008 is a humanized monoclonal antibody targeting PD-1 on the T cell surface, restores T cell activity, thus enhancing immune response, and has the potential to treat various types of tumors. In this study, the tolerance and safety of HX008 in patients with advanced solid tumors will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0

intervention.description: Patients will receive HX008 3mg/kg by intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1, every 3 weeks (Q3W), till progressed disease or withdrawal.

facility.name: Union Hospital affiliated to Tongji Medical College of Huazhong University of Science and Technology
